Dec 28, 2016

A Look Ahead to 2017: Key Dates for the Off-season and Bold Predictions Made Entirely Too Early

The 2016 fantasy season has ended and Dan Klempay’s Youngstown Gangstas are your your TBD Bowl V champions, thoroughly dominating every team that stood in their way. The Gangstas were rarely challenged on the way to their first championship, winning playoff games by an average margin of 35 points and capping off a worst-to-first story that will be probably be milked for at least the first half of next season.

While the 2016 season has only just entered it’s off-season, it’s never too early to start planning and making baseless predictions and generalizations. This is your helpful guide to the nine months between now and the kickoff to the 2017 season. So let’s go!

Key Dates To Remember

Off-season for 2016 Season Begins (Late-December 2016): The day after the TBD Bowl ends. During the off-season, players who were on your final roster can be traded to other teams for picks or players up until the roster freeze date. The Waiver Wire is CLOSED during the Off-season.

Declaration Day (May 2017): This is the deadline to declare your intent to participate in the upcoming 2017 season.

League Rule Proposals (June 2017): Owner’s have until annual league meeting to submit proposals for rule changes.

Annual Owner’s Meeting (June 2017): League owners meet to discuss rule changes and league issues for the coming season. This meeting is also used to discuss what will actually make it out of the dinner and come up for a public vote. It is held at the House of Prime Rib and results in meat sweats galore.

End of Off-season 2016 (July 1, 2017): Rosters are frozen and no transactions may occur until draft day aside from designation of keepers.

League Voting (July 2017): League-wide vote on new rule proposals. Unless otherwise noted, new rules will not be enacted until the following season.

Keeper Designation Deadline (Late August 2017): Teams may declare up to 3 keepers no less than one week prior to the annual draft. As a reminder, players can be kept up to 3 seasons (including their first on your team — even if it was one game) and cost you an accelerated draft pick. See the spreadsheet for details.

Annual Draft (TBD Aug/Sept 2017): League’s annual draft. Transaction freeze lifted. Players may be traded during draft. Season officially begins. The draft order can be found on the league governance page.

Bold Team Predictions for 2017 (Far to early but who cares)

Youngstown Gangstas (2016 record: 9–3, won TBD Bowl V)

The Gangstas will come into the 2017 season as the team to beat with multiple tier 1 players being keeper eligible including RB LeGarrette Blount and QB Matt Ryan (drafted in the 5th and 7th rounds respectively). With rising WRs Dontrelle Inman and Malcolm Mitchell also on the roster and the incoming #1 pick, D2 could be well-positioned for a repeat championship, something no franchise has ever done. The only thing that could beat D2 next year is himself. (Odds of winning TBD Bowl VI: 3 to 2)

McLicker Lites (2016 record: 9–3, lost in TBD Bowl V)

The McLicker Lites captivated the nation on their road to the finals and, for the second straight year, came up short. Coach McVicker has vowed to bring a championship to the Franchise Formerly Known As Harrer and is one of the few teams in the league that owners don’t actually mind losing to. This could help him for off-season moves. Remember, this is a guy who got to the finals with Todd Gurley playing far below his talent level. Both he and QB Derek Carr are keeper eligible and should be back. (Odds of winning TBD Bowl VI: 2 to 1)

Succulent Crabsky (2016 record: 8–4, lost in TBD Bowl Semifinals)

The 2016 champ came up short against the Gangstas in the semifinals, but Coach Andy Lutzky routinely fields a competitive squad having never finished lower than 4th in the league every year since 2013. Question marks remain at QB following the injury to Marcus Mariota, but he could be back next year as could RB DeMarco Murray. He also finished the season with the rights to RB Mike Gillislee, who many believe will increase his workload next year with Buffalo axing Rex Ryan and Shady not getting any younger. Don’t count the former champ out. (Odds of winning TBD Bowl VI: 4 to 1)

Fitz A Kind of Magic (2016 record: 7–5, lost in TBD Bowl Semifinals)

The enigma that is Robert Yegiazaryan. Two time Erin Ruppe Memorial recipient as the league leader in regular season points. No TBD Bowls to show for it. This was supposed to be his year. Robert lost this year due to a missed extra point and Jordan Reed getting ejected — seriously, he lost by .7 points. Still, his team is loaded for next year though it’ll cost him. Most of his marquee players will cost him top 3 round picks. The wildcard is a still-keeper eligible WR named Jordy Nelson. (Odds of winning TBD Bowl VI: 4 to 1)

Dak Pics (2016 record: 7–5, lost in TBD Bowl quarterfinals)

The Dak Pics rode the New Orleans Saints (specifically Drew Brees and Mark Ingram) as far as they’d take them. An early season favorite who sputtered out in the quarterfinals, the Pics will be back (Dak). With superstar WR OBJ ineligible to be kept, it’ll probably be a rebuild year for the Dak Pics, but this shrewd GM knows how to put together a winning squad. No bad contracts on the books means a clean slate to work with. (Odds of winning TBD Bowl VI: 7 to 2)

Feed the Zeke (2016 record: 6–6, lost in TBD Bowl Quarterfinals)

You can only ride the Zeke so far. Coach Halverson got everything he wanted out of the Dallas RB, but it wasn’t enough as the team made barely a wimper in the playoff loss. It’s probably a rebuilding year for the team (they finished 6–6 for the 4th time in 5 years), but with RB Melvin Gordon and TE Cameron Brate to build on — the team could surprise many in 2017. Also fun fact — Dave’s team has finished next to Adam’s every year but 2012. (Odds of winning TBD Bowl VI: 25 to 1)

Dixon(s) Out for Harambe (2016 record: 5–7, lost in TBD Bowl Quarterfinals)

Coach Berg’s team had similar issues to Feed the Zeke, except sub Ezekiel Elliot for David Johnson. Also, Phil Rivers. Never trust Phil Rivers. Sigh. Despite a failed playoff run that cost the team a 4th rounder this year (in exchange for WR T.Y. Hilton), the team seems poised to rebound in 2017. They have a number of interesting assets for the right trade (RBs David Johnson, Tevin Coleman and Kenneth Dixon) and snagged WR and notable Weapon-X, Tyreek Hill. Things can only get better, right? (Odds of winning TBD Bowl VI: 25 to 1)

Jeepers Keepers (2016 record: 6–6, lost in TBD Bowl Quarterfinals)

The younger of the Berg siblings lives and dies by potential her team has the next season. This may be her best off-season yet as TE Delaine Walker could be kept for under his ADP, WR Sterling Shepard is a rising star and WR Tyrell Williams is expected to be a low-end WR1 next year. The question this team will face will be whether or not to rely on an injury-prone RB to take them to the promised land. Last year it was Lamar Miller and this year it was LeSean McCoy. (Odds of winning TBD Bowl VI: 30 to 1)

Cobby Asians (2016 record: 4–8, lost in TBD Bowl Wild Card Round)

The Cinderella Story of avoiding the Harrer Bowl, Coach K(arena) avoided the league’s marquee toilet bowl with a key victory in the final weeks. Riding the back of keeper eligible WR Michael Thomas, Karena’s team should improve on this year’s sub .500 record. (Odds of winning TBD Bowl VI: 35 to 1)

Rmx to Toddnition (2016 record: 4–8, lost in TBD Bowl Wild Card Round)

When you start 10 different RBs over the course of one season, things can only get better. Coach Andrich’s team comes in with keeper-eligible rising star, RB Robert Kelley and one of the league’s best team names. He also still has QB Matt Stafford, who teams constantly count out despite stats routinely in the top 6 QBs of the league. Expect a big turnaround for the Toddnition. (Odds of winning TBD Bowl VI: 20 to 1)

Team Slap & Tickle (2016 record: 4–8, defeated Bubb Rubb in the Harrer Cup)

What a terrible season for Travis Tabet’s squad. Injuries ravaged this team and the off-season begins with news that RB Doug Martin tested positive for PEDs. The former champion slid from playoff team to Harrer Cup participant (his 2nd in 3 years). The good news is that teams that participate in the Harrer Cup twice in three years are 1 for 1 in TBD Bowls. (Odds of winning TBD Bowl VI: 40 to 1)

Bubb Rubb (2016 record: 3–9, lost to Slap & Tickle Bubb Rubb in Harrer Cup)

The season of shame for Commissioner Bauch. He fared well, despite it all. Frank was smart enough to acquire assets for his rebuild and now owns the 12th and 13th picks in this year’s draft. This combined with rising stars (and keeper-eligible) WR Terrelle Pryor and RB CJ Prosise means that this is likely the last time we’ll see the Rubbs at the bottom of the league. (Odds of winning TBD Bowl VI: 30 to 1)
